    • solveQuadraticEquation

      public static double[] solveQuadraticEquation(double a, double b, double c)
      Solves a quadratic equation a + b + c = 0
      Parameters:
      a - a in the equation a + b + c = 0
      b - b in the equation a + b + c = 0
      c - c in the equation a + b + c = 0
      Returns:
      The 2 values of the quadratic equation

    • range

      public static Double[] range(int end, double step)
      returns a sequence of given number between a given range
      Parameters:
      end - integer before which sequence is to be returned. The sequence doesn"t include the end value
      step - increment between the two number in the sequence
      Returns:
      a sequence of given number between a given range

    • range

      public static Integer[] range(int start, int end)
      returns a sequence of given number between a given range
      Parameters:
      start - integer starting from which the sequence is to be returned
      end - integer before which sequence is to be returned. The sequence doesn"t include the end value
      Returns:
      a sequence of given number between a given range

      public static Integer[] range(int end)
      returns a sequence of given number between a given range
      Parameters:
      end - integer before which sequence is to be returned. The sequence doesn"t include the end value
      Returns:
      a sequence of given number between a given range

    • range

      public static Double[] range(int start, int end, double step)
      returns a sequence of given number between a given range
      Parameters:
      start - integer starting from which the sequence is to be returned
      end - integer before which sequence is to be returned. The sequence doesn"t include the end value
      step - increment between the two number in the sequence
      Returns:
      a sequence of given number between a given range

      end - integer before which sequence is to be returned. The sequence doesn"t include the end value

      num - number from which digit is to be extracted
      index - index of the digit that is to be extracted
      Returns:

    • caluclatePercentage

      public static double caluclatePercentage(double full, double... args)
      It calculates the percentage. Here args is the array that is to be given example {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} sum of data given in this array is calculated and stored in a variable sum. Here full is the total sum of which percentage is to be calculated sum / full * 100
      Parameters:
      args - The numbers of which the percentage is to be calculated
      full - The total sum of full from which the percentage is to be calculated
      Returns:
      Percentage

    • caluclatePercentage

      public static double caluclatePercentage(double[] full, double[] args)
      It calculates the percentage. Here args is the array that is to be given example {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} sum of data given in this array is calculated and stored in a variable sum. Here full is the array containing the full value of each element in args array.
      Parameters:
      args - The numbers of which the percentage is to be calculated
      full - The total sum of full from which the percentage is to be calculated
      Returns:
      Percentage

    • calculatePercentage

      public static double calculatePercentage(double total, double full)
      It calculates the percentage. Here total is the sum of array that calculated by the user or programmer and given as parameter Here full is the total sum of which percentage is to be calculated sum / full * 100
      Parameters:
      total - sum of all elements
      full - The total sum of full from which the percentage is to be calculated
      Returns:
      Average

    • calculateAverage

      public static double calculateAverage(double... args)
      It calculates the average here args is an array. The elements of args are those on among which average is calculated. Average is calculated on the basis of number of elements presents in the given array.
      Parameters:
      args - Elements
      Returns:
      Average

    • calculateAverage

      public static double calculateAverage(double total, int noOfElements)
      It returns the average. Here total is the sum of array of data given by the user or programmer. Here noOfElements is the total number of elements in the array of which average is to be calculated.
      Parameters:
      total - Sum of all the elements
      noOfElements - Total number of elements
      Returns:
      total / noOfElements
